definition: that/those/then (in that case)/commonly pr. [nei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing

sentences.english: He was momentarily blinded by the reflection of the sun off his watch.
sentences.chinese: 手錶反射的太陽光讓他有一霎那的失明。

sentences.english: With brief eye contact and slight smile, I felt incomparably happy right at that moment.
sentences.chinese: 簡短的對視和輕輕微笑，一霎那，我幸福無比。

sentences.english: Please wait a moment, Jane is on another line.
sentences.chinese: 請等那一霎那，簡正在接另一條電話線。

sentences.english: The journalist is concerned only with the fugitive moment.
sentences.chinese: 這位新聞工作者所關心的只是一霎那的時刻。

sentences.english: In the moment of love, the nature of emptiness dawns nakedly…
sentences.chinese: 當愛的霎那，空靈乍現赤裸的曙光。

sentences.english: Suddenly, everything shook. It seemed as if the world was at an end.
sentences.chinese: 霎那間，一切都在搖晃，似乎整個世界就要結束。

sentences.english: In the twinkling of an eye, the conjuror pulled a bird out of a cup.
sentences.chinese: 一霎那間魔術師從杯中取出一隻鳥。

sentences.english: And for the briefest of moments, every last man in Shawshank felt free.
sentences.chinese: 就在那一霎那，肖申克監獄的每個人都感到了自由。

sentences.english: It seemed as if the world was at an end.
sentences.chinese: 霎那間，一切都在搖晃，似乎整個世界就要結束。

sentences.english: Less than a nanosecond to attain it, a lifetime of passionate pursuit to maintain it.
sentences.chinese: 霎那間就能實現，但要用一世的熱情追求才能保持。

sentences.english: In a split second, Job lost all of his children.
sentences.chinese: 在一霎那間，約伯失去了他所有的孩子。

definition: an instant (Sanskrit: ksana)/split second/the twinkling of an eye
one instant/very short time/the twinkle of an eye
in the wink of an eye/in a flash
in a flash/in the twinkling of an eye
